thread.title: Red Sox manager Farrell's cancer in remission
thread.title_full: Red Sox manager Farrell's cancer in remission

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Gabrielle McMillen)
title: Red Sox manager Farrell's cancer in remission
text:
Red Sox manager Farrell's cancer in remission Sporting News 16 hrs ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Gabrielle McMillen) © Joy R. Absalon/USA TODAY Sports Boston Red Sox manager John Farrell (53) during a game against the Baltimore Orioles at Oriole Park at Camden Yards on Sept. 21, 2014, in Baltimore. Red Sox manager John Farrell is on his way to being completely cancer-free.
AdChoices MORE: Top 10 Red Sox players of all time
The team announced Thursday Farrell is in remission after he was diagnosed with stage 1 Non-Hodgkin’s Burkitt lymphoma in August during a hernia surgery. He underwent testing on Wednesday that determined the positive outlook.
Farrell will speak to reporters tomorrow. His statement today: pic.twitter.com/UprX1mk7IF
— Pete Abraham (@PeteAbe) October 22, 2015
Farrell is expected to make a full recovery and, according to the Red Sox, will return as the team's manager in 2016 , with interim manager Torey Luvollo going back to his original position as bench coach.
